items.lore: Strangers held together by shared past, entwined in a fray, never to unite again.
items.name: Divergence

items.lore: For when one needs to carve the smallest stone or pick the smallest lock, the subtleties of precision approach impossibility.
items.name: Infinitesimal

items.lore: From nothing to everything, forever past to forever more, the vastness of eternity is obscured by the sameness of tomorrow.
items.name: Continuum

items.lore: Curious, isn't it, that unending complexity can feel so plain in one's hand, yet pull deeper than eyes can see and minds can fathom?
items.name: Fractal

items.lore: To call an end a new beginning implies there ever was a beginning, or ever will be an end.
items.name: Recursion

majorIds.name: Perfect Recall
majorIds.description: &b+Perfect Recall: &3Memory Recollection adds 1 extra spell. Increases Chaos Explosion's mana bank requirement to 150.

majorIds.name: Soul Eater
majorIds.description: &b+Soul Eater: &3Devour and Harvester grant double mana. Decreases maximum marks by 1.

items.lore: They must know what you went through. They must suffer the same as you did.

majorIds.name: Furious Effigy
majorIds.description: &b+Furious Effigy: &3Totem effects are twice as fast, but duration is halved

items.name: Panic Zealot

majorIds.name: Rally
majorIds.description: &b+Rally: &3Charge heals you by 10% and nearby allies by 15% on impact, but becomes harmless

items.lore: Deceptively plain-looking, this spear has been infused with energy from all five known elements. Its tip shimmers in a spectrum of colors.
items.name: Infused Hive Spear

majorIds.name: Greed
majorIds.description: &b+Greed: &3Picking up emeralds heals you and nearby players for 15% max health

items.lore: Deceptively plain-looking, this dagger has been infused with energy from all five known elements. It leaves afterimages that pulsate in a spectrum of colors.
items.name: Infused Hive Dagger

items.lore: Deceptively plain-looking, this wand has been infused with energy from all five known elements. It subtly glows in a spectrum of colors.
items.name: Infused Hive Wand

majorIds.name: Strings of Fate
majorIds.description: &b+Strings of Fate: &3Your puppets have a lifetime of 3 seconds, and deal double damage with attacks and explosions.

items.lore: Deceptively plain-looking, this relik has been infused with energy from all five known elements. The head gleams in a spectrum of colors.
items.name: Infused Hive Relik

items.lore: Deceptively plain-looking, this bow has been infused with energy from all five known elements. Its string radiates a spectrum of colors.
items.name: Infused Hive Bow

items.lore: This mysterious, half-liquid trident apparently holds the secret magics to control the ocean's ebb and flow. It is incapable of touching solid ground.
items.name: Tidebinder

items.lore: Seems like the name is misspelled a little bit.
items.name: Braker

items.lore: The spelling seems to have been botched.
items.name: Slider

items.lore: Wielding it for too long will leave one a dessicated husk, as this dull blade slowly absorbs all liquids around it.
items.name: Sitis

items.lore: Hewn from the great obsidian spires surrounding the massive Nether gate, this fiercely-hooked dagger absorbs light and magic energy alike to create a desolate void wherever it is wielded.
items.name: Black

items.lore: The notorious and erratic magical inventor Gawrick once attempted to make teleportation scrolls obsolete, by creating items which would allow the user to phase into an ethereal state to move unhindered. He did not account for the physical ramifications of this process, however.
items.name: Warp

items.lore: The existence of all things is reflected in the otherworldly jewels of this grand staff, dense enough to have its own gravitational pull. Users have reported their limbs being stretched after usage.
items.name: Singularity

items.lore: A mage by the name of Lero claims to have harnessed the sheer power of lightning using a magical staff, however, the weapon is very unreliable in a pinch.
items.name: Fatal

items.lore: It looks like they spelled the name wrong...
items.name: Bonder

items.lore: The name has got to be misspelled... It doesn't even make any sense!
items.name: Lower

items.lore: The Elves managed to harness the power of air itself, forming a bow made entirely of air currents, allowing the user to move swift like the wind, but vulnerable to attacks.
items.name: Stratiformis

items.lore: If it weren't for that stray mark, this would be spelled correctly...
items.name: Stinger

items.lore: Perhaps one is weak. To be ignored. Perhaps two are not much better. But what of five? Ten? Twenty?...
items.name: Cluster

majorIds.name: Forest's Blessing
majorIds.description: &b+Forest's Blessing: &3Your archer summons have increased movement speed, attack speed, and vision. Bomb Arrow's damage is reduced by &6✢ &3-30%.

majorIds.name: Divine Honor
majorIds.description: &b+Divine Honor: &3Increases the bonus from Radiance by 5%. Bash deals &2✤ &3-15% per hit.

items.lore: This wand merges with the user on touch, bringing about horrific changes to them. Elongated nails, sharp teeth and the ability to breathe fire are trademarks of the beast.
items.name: Monster

items.lore: A great magical cataclysm at Mage Island brought on by a strange, seemingly disconnected series of events resulted in this wand absorbing nearly uncontrollably high levels of magic.
items.name: Cascade

majorIds.name: Dead Weight
majorIds.description: &b+Dead Weight: &3Totem's horizontal velocity is greatly increased at the cost of vertical movement

items.lore: Arrows fired by this bow are pure ice, but when they hit the enemy, burst into magical water, flash-freezing all that it touches. The frost burns will never heal.
items.name: Spring

items.lore: The runes carved onto the spear shift appearance so quickly as to be illegible, but those who wield it supposedly will learn their meaning.
items.name: Harwrol

items.lore: Despite the light weight of the weapon, the spearhead has been made from incredibly dense cosmic stone. A strong enough impact can directly destroy matter. Due to this danger, it is sought after to be destroyed.

majorIds.name: Fission
majorIds.description: &b+Fission: &3Explosions from your Exploding ID are twice as big and twice as strong

items.name: Collapse

items.lore: Spiritual enlightenment is a goal that many monks hope to one day grasp the barest glimpse of, often thought to be a goal that must be worked towards over a lifetime. Holding this polished, translucent blade will instantly induce that lofty state until it is let go.

majorIds.name: Transcendence
majorIds.description: &b+Transcendence: &330% chance for spells to cost no mana when casted

items.name: Nirvana

items.lore: The Dogun God Garaheth was actually an immense fire demon occupying the bowels of Molten Heights. Although unwise, the Dwarves forged a demonic dagger using his tooth in celebration of his slaughter.
items.name: Inferno

items.lore: The Dernel tribes revere various nature deities, each in their own unique fashions. One of the most notable was that of a lost tribe, who fashioned this blossoming stave as tribute to their deity of the earth itself.
items.name: Gaia

items.lore: One of the first dwarven theories of the increasing quakes in east Gavel was that the freezing of a Dogun town in the Heights also froze a massive underground spring, disrupting the earth and chain-reacting across the province.
items.name: Cryoseism

items.lore: Unruly magics of void and darkness are tamed within this bow's string. While those energies are never to be released, arrows fired from it fire at such blinding speeds so as to phase out of existence when they hit their target.
items.name: Divzer

items.lore: Contents under pressure.

majorIds.name: Freerunner
majorIds.description: &b+Freerunner: &3When your sprint bar is under 30% full, increase your sprint speed by +150%

items.name: Air In A Can

items.lore: The raw aspect of thunder, though claimed to be harnessed by a mage in a wand, has only been truly tamed by this mighty blade. Combined electric and life-draining magic intertwine and bring forth the truest, most frightening power of all Thunder.
items.name: Thrundacrack

items.lore: A relic of the past in Time Valley was weathered down to a dagger by the sheer power of the wind. When used in battle, mysterious intertwined wind and time magic give it no physical presence.

majorIds.name: Roving Assassin
majorIds.description: &b+Roving Assassin: &3Vanish will no longer block mana and health regeneration

items.name: Weathered

items.lore: The holy blade of the House of Talor was crafted of pure unicorn horns, and consecrated by a hundred priests. Evil spirits are driven away by its mere presence.
items.name: Ivory

items.lore: Found at the site of the Caritat Mansion, this simple-looking glove is bathed in dark presence. It wracks those who wear it with pain, and instills the belief that the only way to end the pain is not to remove the item, but to inflict that same torment upon all others.
items.name: Grimtrap

items.lore: Despite the existence of the Nether Portal, few believe that it is possible to open such rifts with sheer force alone. None believe that a tool with enough power to accomplish such a monumental feat could exist. And yet...
items.name: Cataclysm

items.lore: One of many lost artifacts from the legendary Wind Fortress, the engraving appears to be a cryptic clue to where the Fortress fell. "We shall be found among the dark winds of the morrow."
items.name: Morrowind

items.lore: When the lost city of Sarnfic sunk beneath the depths, nothing but the bubbles of screams and this single wand surfaced. When used, you can still hear the towns lament.
items.name: Lament

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\] Forged with flaming scales shorn from Ozoth, the fabled Golden Ninja of the Canyon of the Lost hunted his prey relentlessly using this lightweight, yet harder than steel, polearm.
items.name: Ignition

items.lore: Intricate carvings and images, almost like that of a totem pole, cover the shaft of this marvelous trident, dredged up from the Seavale Reef. Foreign magics heighten the senses of its user in battle, but also instills a longing for the ocean. Many have succumbed to this urge and drowned themselves.
items.name: Idol

items.lore: The diminutive stature of this item belies its abilities. Absorbing and expelling magical energy in precise bursts, it protects the user from all manner of attacks while punishing those who dare strike.
items.name: Nullification

items.lore: This bow, used by the dwarves to land the final blow in the slaughter of Garaheth is extremely powerful. Special, fire resistant gloves must be worn at all times to prevent burns to the user.

majorIds.name: Heart of the Pack
majorIds.description: &b+Heart of the Pack: &3Nearby players gain 35% of the health you naturally regenerate

items.name: Ignis

items.lore: The very first crossbow in existence was claimed to be utterly indestructible, but it is only true to a fault. The item cannot be broken, but solely because all damage to it is instead reflected onto the user. As its age is uncountably ancient, wielders will find themselves rapidly aging and withering away with even a mere touch.
items.name: Grandmother

items.lore: Those who have used this near-weightless bow all seem to tell tales of how they see Gale's spirit fighting alongside them.
items.name: Gale's Force

items.lore: Soul-locking magic is one outlawed by Gavellian governments, only used by the most insidious and cruel of mages. One such enchantment looms dormant in this mundane-looking maul. Continued usage of the weapon threatens to release it upon the wielder, permanently binding them to the weapon.
items.name: Alkatraz

items.lore: The magically rejuvenating properties of phoenix ash were imbued into this grand stave in its creator's bid to gain immortality.
items.name: Phoenix Wing

items.lore: Combined power of inscribed Uth runes and sheer rage intertwine to create a fearsome sight, as this weapon is merely a spiritual extension of the user's desire for total destruction.
items.name: Zephra Shredder

items.lore: A vow of protection hangs over this spear, now inhabited by the spirit of a legendary heroine. Even simply a glimpse of the burning blade will instill a feeling of protection and security, and that feeling will hold true if one is brave enough to wield it.

majorIds.name: Guardian
majorIds.description: &b+Guardian: &335% of damage taken by nearby allies is redirected to you

items.name: Guardian

items.lore: Combined power of inscribed Uth runes and consuming fury combine to create a deadly aura, as this weapon is merely a spiritual extension of the user's desire for utter cataclysm.
items.name: Thrunda Ripsaw

items.lore: Found abandoned in the ruins of the Doguns, these odd weapons are designed to shoot jets of sheer flame instead of hitting enemies traditionally. They are in terrible disrepair, and none know how to fix them.
items.name: Flameshot Hilt

items.lore: Combined power of inscribed Uth runes and immense wisdom meld to create a commanding aura, as this weapon is merely a spiritual extension of the user's desire for dominion over all.
items.name: Nepta Floodbringer

items.lore: Freedom of soul, mind, and body are forced upon all those that this bow's arrows impact, and freedom of caring from the atrocities that such a dangerous weapon can inflict is given to all those that hold it.
items.name: Freedom

items.lore: Combined power of inscribed Uth runes and raw potential fuse to create an imposing presence, as this weapon is merely a spiritual extension of the user's desire for complete obliteration.
items.name: Alka Cometflinger

items.lore: Stone shorn from mountains by the roiling sea gathered on the shores of Llevigar one day, washed onto the sand in the shape of a massive spear. It was taken as an omen, and the stones were forged into a true weapon.
items.name: Bedruthan

items.lore: The world revolves around you, after all. It's high time you spread the news!

majorIds.name: Geocentrism
majorIds.description: &b+Geocentrism: &3Aura radiates from you instead of your Totem and can be cast any time

items.name: Narcissist

items.lore: The Order of the Abyss crafted this bow in opposition to the House of Talor's holy relic. Holding it for too long will strain and warp the user's mind.
items.name: Hellstrand

items.lore: Enigmatically, this weapon will only show itself to those who believe themselves to be worth nothing, or to be weak. While utilizing this weapon will greatly strengthen one's resolve, it will disappear when it is no longer needed, going to the next wielder.

majorIds.name: Saviour’s Sacrifice
majorIds.description: &b+Saviour’s Sacrifice: &3While under 50% maximum health, nearby allies gain 20% bonus damage and defence

items.name: Hero

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Starburst

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Sigil of Existence

items.lore: This enigmatic weapon can suddenly blink out of reality with no warning only to appear exactly where it was left later. Artificers have determined that almost the entire bow, by all known laws of nature and magic, should not exist.
items.name: Return to Ether

items.lore: This bloody palette knife was used to kill only two people before it was abandoned - a killer who broke into a great artist's home, and the artist who struck the blow.
items.name: Alizarin

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Squall's Breath

items.lore: The wear upon this broken old battle spear does not affect its ability in battle. The souls of a thousand fallen warriors resound within it.
items.name: Tisaun's Proof

items.lore: Holding this relik sends sparks through your veins, making your heart beat fast. And faster. And faster and faster and--
items.name: Overdrive

items.lore: And as the spring bursts, the blossom petals flutter in the wind amongst the ashes of your enemies.

majorIds.name: Cherry Bombs
majorIds.description: &b+Cherry Bombs: &3Turn Smoke Bomb into three firecrackers that fly farther, tighter, and deal high damage instantly

items.name: Blossom Haze

items.lore: From the Nether Gate, a shard of cosmic stone was ejected. Its purity was defiled, and the first man to wield it went mad, raving about the fall of the cosmos' beauty.
items.name: Lunar Spine

items.lore: The unstable power within this bow is capable of great destruction, but seems to zero out at the most crucial moments in battle. Only the most skillful archers can wield this weapon with confidence.
items.name: Zero

items.lore: Built by Cerid to accrue raw static charge from the surroundings and direct it at opponents, the blade's chief failing is that the wielder is not rendered immune to their own discharge as intended.
items.name: Brass Brand

items.lore: Once a contract is formed, and before its details are discussed, a seal is placed on the human's body.
items.name: Faustian Contract

items.lore: This spear is bright enough that it can cause blindness if you look directly at it. Its immense power is limited by its weight; the weapon is nearly impossible to lift.
items.name: Proxima

items.lore: ...I'll finish writing this later.

majorIds.name: Peaceful Effigy
majorIds.description: &b+Peaceful Effigy: &3Your Totem will last twice as long

items.name: Procrastination

items.lore: The tides of the ocean, once bound, became useful magic power sources. They were once utilized for weapons, but to harness the unstable force of the raging sea was considered too dangerous.
items.name: Torrential Tide

items.lore: Named for an ancient Wynnic word for "Earthquake", this mighty battle hammer causes the very bones of struck enemies to rattle and heave as though the earth itself was splitting under their feet.
items.name: Rikter

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Aersectra

items.lore: An extremely rare metallic ore only found within the island region of Corkus, it is normally used in decorative dyes. However, a mishap one day caused the discovery of strange and cumulative effects when exposed to traditional magicks.
items.name: Bismuthinite

items.lore: To forge a weapon such as this from the cursed lava of the portal basin requires dozens, for each smith would lose themselves to the force of corruption before it is finished. The nightmarishly hooked blade serves no purpose but destruction, as intended.

majorIds.name: Hellfire
majorIds.description: &b+Hellfire: &3Boiling Blood has no cooldown, is stronger, and does not slow. Cuts Bash's power and disables Discombobulate

items.name: Apocalypse

items.lore: Potentially one of the most dangerous weapons in existence. A precise enough shot can destroy the soul of those it hits.
items.name: Spiritshock

items.lore: Time moves in strange ways around this translucent blade, speeding and slowing, starting and stopping, with no observable reasoning or pattern.

majorIds.name: Sorcery
majorIds.description: &b+Sorcery: &330% chance for spells and attacks to cast a second time at no additional cost

items.name: Rewind

items.lore: Well...it is a very pretty-looking stick, but aside from that it just appears to be a plain old stick.
items.name: Gert Super Special Magic Ultistick

items.lore: This golden staff was recovered from deep within the tombs of Almuj. Nothing else was found in the room except the words 'Beware the user with unlimited imagination.'
items.name: Empire Builder

items.lore: The creator of this polished white blade insists that its true power will never be unlocked, for only those who are not influenced by the elements of the world know truly how to utilize it.
items.name: Blade of Purity

items.lore: You will probably irreversibly harm yourself with this, but when has that ever stopped you?

majorIds.name: Furious Effigy
majorIds.description: &b+Furious Effigy: &3Totem effects are twice as fast, but duration is halved

items.name: Tachypsychia

items.lore: Reconstructed from mere wooden scraps of its former self, this extremely heavy crossbow still contains immense power. It was intended for use with a lost suit of armor, of which only one piece remains.
items.name: Heracul

items.lore: This staff was expertly crafted from fragile spun glass, and tinted with various magical foci that bend light into its most raw components.
items.name: Prymari

items.lore: Stories say that should anyone wield both of these fearsome gauntlets in battle, they will become unkillable in a fight. The second gauntlet, however, has never been found.
items.name: Arma Gauntlet

items.lore: Mysterious runes, held by inexplicable ancient guardians, were once moulded together for study purposes. The experiment went awry, as the runic words Nii, Az, and Ek were combined in a reaction that resulted in the collapse of a civilization.
items.name: Az

items.lore: This wand is capable of attacks so fast that it appears to flicker in and out of existence. Anyone able to access its full potential will be seen as only a blur to their enemies.
items.name: Afterimage

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\] This peculiar weapon was once wielded by the firey warrior Igbar, who used it to great effect in nether-endurance competitions.
items.name: Toaster

items.lore: A psychopath claiming herself to be Death incarnate used this dark-bladed scythe on a killing spree that lasted over a year. It reaped hundreds of lives, including her own.
items.name: Scythe

items.lore: One of Skien's many deadly weapons. This warhammer, despite the massive weight of the hammerhead, was able to be swung by Skien fast enough to be a blur.
items.name: Helm Splitter

items.lore: Despite appearing as a basic blade when held, strange spiritual magic changes its form into a sharp, ring-like cutting edge when used to attack. Only one person was known to master the weapon's abilities.
items.name: Chakram

items.lore: The fabled weapon of the titular dark Assassin, the blade's small stature hides its true powers. Shadows undulate about the hilt.
items.name: Blade of Shade

items.lore: Crafted exclusively by the Temple of the Legends' mages, this stave is honorary to Mages who best the Temple's Grand Magus.
items.name: Stave of the Legends

items.lore: Supposedly based off of the wand of master mage Ethe, this wand is plated with magic-focusing jewels and heavy gold, yet somehow remains entirely weightless.
items.name: Ethereal

items.lore: Lost by master sailor Carvel in a massive storm, it was carried all the way out to the city of Selchar, where it was found spewing seafoam and lightning bolts.
items.name: Maelstrom

items.lore: The unwieldy, yet imposing stature of this massive sickle strikes awe into those who view it. Those who have the will to wield it, however, seem to garner respect from all those around them, as though they had become a god.
items.name: Archangel

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: The Eviscerator

items.lore: This indestructible dagger was found floating in the magma of the Molten Heights, with a lament from its exiled smith carved onto the hilt.
items.name: The Exile

items.lore: Carved directly from the mysterious rock that hit Gavel 50 years ago, this pure white wand glows with cosmic energy unknown.

majorIds.name: Gravity Well
majorIds.description: &b+Gravity Well: &3Meteor has increased blast radius and pulls enemies instead

items.name: Pure

items.lore: Watch as they receive your gift of imminent disaster and endless fallout.

majorIds.name: Fission
majorIds.description: &b+Fission: &3Explosions from your Exploding ID are twice as big and twice as strong

items.name: Hesperium

items.lore: Not knowing what's going on is the best part!

majorIds.name: Juggle
majorIds.description: &b+Juggle: &3Stronger Multihit adds an additional 12 hits. All hits are reduced by &6✢ &3-10%.

items.name: Roiling Ruckus

items.lore: "If anyone finds this, leave it at my Gale's gravesite. I promised her a memento, too." This inscription is extremely weathered.
items.name: Ohms' Wish

items.lore: Despite this mace never seeing use by Remikas, it was seen as a symbol of the might of his rule over Gavel. Its true abilities in battle have never been seen.
items.name: Remikas' Righteousness

items.lore: The powerful psychic energies surrounding this bow are rumored to increase accuracy, though this has not been refuted by any reliable source.
items.name: Clairvoyance

items.lore: Wielded by the chief of the Tromsian jungle's zombie tribes, the augmentable crystals within it focus natural elemental energies to intense levels.
items.name: Kahontsi Ohstyen

items.lore: Carried by the Olux Plague Doctor, this simple-looking stick subtly oozes with an unidentifiable substance that is invigorating to the holder, and lethally venomous to anything else.

majorIds.name: Plague
majorIds.description: &b+Plague: &3Poisoned mobs spread their poison to nearby mobs

items.name: Plague Staff

items.lore: This bow's thick string fails to shoot arrows effectively, but instead produces low frequency sound waves that erupt from the source in all directions. The sound can implode the eardrums of an enemy with a single strum.
items.name: Soundwave

items.lore: One of the most unstable wands known to man, using the bark of the Flerisi trunk it reaps firey destruction upon its enemies.
items.name: Diablo

items.lore: Skien's trust in others was shattered permanently by the wielder of this dagger, who fell to the corruption and attacked his legion during a great corrupted siege.
items.name: Locrian

items.lore: Everything slowly loses heat, and will eventually stop moving. Are you prepared?

majorIds.name: Flashfreeze
majorIds.description: &b+Flashfreeze: &3Ice Snake is instant and freezes for +1s

items.name: Heat Death

items.lore: Only the most honourable warriors of Gavel's army are presented the fearsome, fiery spear forged from the rarest metals of the Molten Heights.
items.name: Fierte

items.lore: This expertly crafted spear was forged by a cryptid-researching fanatic. It shines brilliantly in even the weakest sunlight.
items.name: Olux's Prized Spear

items.lore: This expertly crafted dagger was smithed by a cryptid-researching fanatic. It can chop through even the thickest of the swamp's clay with ease.
items.name: Olux's Prized Dagger

items.lore: This expertly crafted wand was shaped by a cryptid-researching fanatic. It shimmers with the purest water from the swamp.
items.name: Olux's Prized Wand

items.lore: This expertly crafted relik was notched by a cryptid-researching fanatic. Its feathers and baubles chime with a soothing melody.
items.name: Olux's Prized Relik

items.lore: This expertly crafted bow was whittled by a cryptid-researching fanatic. Its frame was cut from the very toughest tree roots.
items.name: Olux's Prized Bow

items.lore: If you reach for ammunition from your quiver, as long as you have a single arrow, you will find you never run out.
items.name: Infinity

items.lore: Prolonged exposure to the corruption may cause sudden bursts of madness in soldiers. To assure themselves of their sanity, some have even begun to play tricks on their brethren.
items.name: Impulse

items.lore: Crafted from Mandragora roots and adorned with decorative wreaths of Elven pines, these wands are utilized in Efilim's solstice festivals to celebrate each passing year of Villager and Elven comradery.
items.name: Bough of Fir

items.lore: A grave digger uncovered this blade from the resting place of a notorious pirate that pillaged the islands of the ocean for four decades.
items.name: Reaper of Soul

items.lore: No one expected the WynnExcavation volcanic site to produce any valuable materials, but this heavy, obsidian-blend bow silenced the critics.
items.name: Eruption

items.lore: Dwarven folklore tells of this mighty maul, used by gods to break mountains, shape continents, and crack the earth to form caverns.

majorIds.name: Temblor
majorIds.description: &b+Temblor: &3Bash gains +1 Area of Effect and is 25% faster

items.name: Fissure

items.lore: Discipline and experience is channeled into these wands for 10 years in the Bantisu monastery of the canyon, in the hope that they will pass on its teachings to less experienced users.
items.name: Sage

items.lore: No eyes see past the dark fog that enshrouds the future. But if you could perhaps light the way, what would you see? Invigorating hope? Or a warning to be heeded?
items.name: Temporal Lantern

items.lore: The weapon of the fearsome lone bandit, Rymek Luke, it is unique in that it is designed to fire small metal rounds instead of more traditional projectiles.

majorIds.name: Hawkeye
majorIds.description: &b+Hawkeye: &3Condense Arrow Storm into a tight beam. Arrows deal &6✢ &310%, &e✦ &31%, and &f❋ &31%

items.name: Deadeye

items.lore: The density of this weapon is almost immeasurable. Despite being light and easy to wield, the spear seems to have its own gravitational pull, slowly dragging enemies closer and making it nearly impossible to put down.
items.name: Pulsar

items.lore: This dagger has no blade. Instead, it is layered with the stingers of the Black Shadow Scorpion, which has the ability to vanish entirely from its prey.
items.name: Scorpion

items.lore: This bow has no string. Instead, a thin lightning-like thread is strung upon it. It is said to be limited only by the speed of the user.
items.name: Thunderbolt

items.lore: The blazing sun has been revered by many druidic sects as a god in its own right, and the jewel in this brilliant wand glows with the brightness of their holy star.
items.name: Glare

items.lore: The weapon nearly catches fire during the merchant's demonstration. He still refuses to discount it despite this.
items.name: Upgraded Flare Blitz

items.lore: "The plants loathe to take hold upon the red stone. And so, we must hunt instead."  -Caras, Owl Tribesman
items.name: Sprout

items.lore: "When payback is the rule of the land, it feels safest to do nothing."  -Ormrod, Self-exiled Almuj Resident
items.name: Karma

items.lore: Every time this spear hits an enemy, a sharp electrical jolt hits the users hands that forces powerful lightning to release.
items.name: Fierce Thunder

items.lore: "Betrayal stings sharper than a scorpion's tail, and festers worse than the poison inside."   -Attributed to Hashr
items.name: Hashr Claw

items.lore: "It never rains here, but we hear the thunder echoing in the distance."  -Lanu, Almuj Archaeomancer
items.name: Clunderthap

items.lore: "My husband's such a scaredy-cat. What good is tomb raiding if you're not in the tomb?"  -Dr. Junes, Almuj Archaeologist
items.name: Chaser

items.lore: The blade seems sharper than normal, but it also seems rather brittle. The smithing was obviously a hack-job...
items.name: Upgraded Whisper

items.lore: The blade is covered in tape that's been scribbled on in order to make it look fiery. This doesn't seem like a wise purchase.
items.name: Upgraded HellRaiser

items.lore: "Bandit attacks losing you sleep? Free fighting classes here! Only 10  emeralds- they won't know what hit 'em!" -Almuj Self-Defense Class Advertisement
items.name: Jaw Breaker

items.lore: This knife does not belong in your hands... yet somehow it feels right at home.
items.name: Influence

items.lore: Apparently, they thought to make a long bow better, they should make it longer. You can barely hold it.
items.name: Upgraded Long Bow

items.lore: "I have to wonder just how healthy slime found in the depths of a desert  cavern can be to drink." -Eluzterp, Almuj resident
items.name: Miasma

items.lore: It seems stronger at first glance, but upon closer inspection the blade is rather...soft?
items.name: Upgraded Archpriest

items.lore: "The sun and related symbols appear quite often in these ancient glyphs.  Interesting, but unsurprising, no?" -Svin, Legend Keeper
items.name: Sol

items.lore: According to the merchant, the wand is extra flammable, so that it can burn up and disappear with all the mages quicker.
items.name: Upgraded Phoenix

items.lore: "It feels like all these "ancient" civilizations have better tech than we do nowadays."  -Knox, Corkus Immigrant and Sandstorm Vandals bandit
items.name: Tremolo

items.lore: "100% curse-free or your money back!" The merchant explained that this policy is not legally binding after you read it.
items.name: Upgraded Cursed Bow

items.lore: The two mesa tribes once were allies until their sacred totems were stolen. Before that time, however, they often shared their talents, and this bow hewn from mesa stone was one such lost craft.
items.name: Mesarock Arch

items.lore: The mystery of the ocean’s appearance has eluded scholars for centuries. It is believed that many years ago, warlocks used wands like this one in an attempt to submerge the world.
items.name: Waves Raiser

items.lore: Did the merchant really think that adding severed bat wings to the weapon would make it more authentic?
items.name: Upgraded Echolocation

items.lore: It is significantly heavier than usual...you can't tell if that is good or not, in this case.
items.name: Upgraded Steel Buster

items.lore: The inscribed lyrics have been scratched out and replaced with a barely-legible insult.
items.name: Upgraded Lullaby

items.lore: The craftsmanship on this bow is rather poor. The paint on the "crystals" is chipping...
items.name: Upgraded Radiance

items.lore: The guard on the spear is smaller, but at least twice as thick. What purpose does that have?
items.name: Upgraded Vartija

items.lore: This blackiron blade was left to sear in the desert for months on end by a fanatical berserker. It burned him alive as he cut down those who opposed him.
items.name: Chaleur

items.lore: The blade actually looks to be of good quality, unlike the other products. The only problem is the questionable stain covering most of it.
items.name: Upgraded Scalpel

items.lore: A mystical sapling native to the shores of Mage Island has been fashioned into this simple staff. Even uprooted, you notice its continuous growth.
items.name: Blossom

items.lore: Even reduced to just the bones, you can't help but feel bad for the poor thing this paw came from.
items.name: Wybel Paw

items.lore: The art of endurance fighting is a skill lost to time. However, a thief that to this day has not been caught, imbued this dagger with the very same ability.
items.name: Stabsand

items.lore: There are parts from at least six separately recognizable weapons mashed together to make this. There's no way it's effective.
items.name: Upgraded Melange

items.lore: Quick, over there!

majorIds.name: Overwhelm
majorIds.description: &b+Overwhelm: &3Bash will hit +2 times

items.name: Overreach

items.lore: One who forsook all others in pursuit of their own gain forced an extension of their own will into existence. This culmination of that will consumes all it touches.
items.name: Blazing Ruin

items.lore: The flickering flame atop this simple wand is a marvel of magic. It always burns at a comfortable heat, cannot scorch skin even if touched, and never can be snuffed out under any circumstance.
items.name: Red Candle

items.lore: The weathered oar of Haros, the outcast ferryman of Charon's Forsaken Legion. Magical implements have been jury-rigged onto the silver pole, glowing dull out of his bony grasp.
items.name: Haros' Oar

items.lore: A year-long monsoon soaked this Nemract-made bow so much, that it has harnessed the very essence of water.
items.name: Nemract's Rage

items.lore: "Those bloody zombies don't kip down at night, what makes you think a curfew might bally-well help?" -General Graken, Nemract Militia
items.name: Abolition

items.lore: "We'll ensure that under our watch, all your families will be reunited!" -Haros, of the Banished Legion
items.name: Death's Reach

items.lore: "Can anyone else understand that General Graken? Because I can't." -Commander Takan, Nemract Militia
items.name: Sanies

items.lore: The magic in this wand seems much weaker than normal...and there's a rather rude message written on the handle.
items.name: Upgraded Dark Needle

items.lore: "The dead can still hear. I figure a lullaby might help convince them to sleep a bit longer." -Merloni, Saint's Row Priest
items.name: Hymn of the Dead

items.lore: "And no one's going to save us from the beasts about to strike. We've seen horrors stare us in the eyes, and we're fighting for our lives." -Poe, Nemract Sewer Dweller
items.name: Thriller

items.lore: "I got a name, known far and wide! Run along, you bandit scum, before you have to learn it the hard way!" -Sayleros' Brother, killed by bandits
items.name: Damnation

items.lore: "The gravestone for the brother of that man, Sayleros? For whatever reason, it didn't have a proper name on it." -Sacre, Saint's Row Priest
items.name: Cathedral

items.lore: Used for endurance training on the Icy Islands, this bow forces the wielder's body temperature to drop to near-hypothermic levels.
items.name: Glacial Crest

items.lore: Many have tried to duplicate the properties of this spear, but very few have succeeded in enchanting a spearhead with explosive magic that does not cause the spear itself to explode.
items.name: Legendary Smasher

items.lore: Once having held unstoppable amounts of magic, being forced to fuse into one form locked away all but the smallest sliver of their power.
items.name: The Divide

items.lore: "Never wish to see a dead loved one again. In this day and age, they'll come back to see you." -Mylo, Nemract Conscript
items.name: Styx's Grab

items.lore: "Leave us down here to die, why don't you all. Just turn us into another statistic and be done, huh?" -Ragamal, Nemract Sewer Dweller
items.name: Putrid

items.lore: One of Detlas’ buildings was struck by lightning 60 years ago and burnt to the ground, apart from one wooden beam that began to glow. It was fashioned into an exclusive wand for resident mages.
items.name: Detlas' Legacy

items.lore: "If you squish a spider egg, sometimes little spiders pop out. So, squish the whole area instead!" -Captain Fenor, Detlas Legion
items.name: Maul

items.lore: The reigning king of thieves in Almuj’s underworld would brandish this golden dagger to his enemies so fast, you wouldn’t even realise your wallet was now missing.
items.name: Almuj's Daggers

items.lore: "I am not making this up! That spider teleported ONTO MY FACE!" -Stiba, Elemental Researcher
items.name: Iklaj

items.lore: "And you thought walking into a cobweb was bad." -Ope, Ragni Botanist
items.name: Web Spitter

items.lore: Forged from unbreakable obsidian eras ago, this heavy hammer has crushed many foes with a single swing.
items.name: The Berserk

items.lore: "Not every spider is venomous, but do you really want to get bitten by them all to figure out which are?" -Alvin, Nivla Forest Resident
items.name: Fangs

items.lore: "I saw that spider queen once. It felt like it was only a matter of time before she found my home, so I moved here." -Babhla, Nivla Bowl Merchant
items.name: Hourglass

items.lore: "I swear on my life those spiders were covered in spikes! Go out there, see if I'm wrong!" -Suri, Elemental Researcher
items.name: Sting

items.lore: Many old mages had to perform lengthy incantations to make potent even their simplest spells. A mage cursed to be mute, however, brought upon a revolution to spellcasting through this simple wand.
items.name: Reticence

items.lore: The average bow can boast a range of skills, but unlike this one, not every bow can penetrate through any organic skin, including dragon hide.
items.name: Skin Piercer

items.lore: These bulky-looking gauntlets are actually extremely lightweight, being created of a magical elf-blessed iron alloy blend.
items.name: Iron Knuckle

items.lore: Despite being proven unrelated, this enigmatic bow was the lynchpin to beginning the great search for the Relics.
items.name: Relic

items.lore: The wear on this humble war pick's blade has only made it more effective in combat, allowing its users to make unexpected parries of opponents' attacks by hooking and hitting through the weapon.
items.name: Clash Hook

items.lore: Wielded by the master of the Decrepit Sewers Dungeon, the arrows of this bow causes the target's body to slowly wither away.
items.name: Witherhead's Bow

items.lore: "I bet those sewer-dwellers have horrible morning breath." -Folzoy, Maltic Escort
items.name: Serpent's Kiss

items.lore: It is thought that this primitive wand was used by early man to create the first spells. It is made from a wood that no longer exists.
items.name: Ancient Wand

items.lore: This heavy crossbow forces a strange compulsion in its users when wielded. They will often refuse to even shoot unless entirely certain of a hit.
items.name: Crackshot

items.lore: "Even a corrupted would get crushed by one of these!" -Roche 'Stone-thrower' Diamant, Ragni Citizen
items.name: Skull Breaker

items.lore: Often, the leader of brute gangs would use this dagger to threaten his followers into making sure they did not fail him.
items.name: Dislocater

items.lore: "The first time I saw one of those zombies I nearly had a heart attack! The blighters are terrifying." -Rynend, Maltic Citizen
items.name: Defibrillator

items.lore: "There's never new water flowing into those sewers. It all cycles back into itself...not natural." -Jenprest, Ragni Legion 2nd Division
items.name: Stale

items.lore: "Catch a fresh-raised corrupted, it's like catching a soldier without his morning coffee. Stumbly and unfocused." -Enzan, Retired Ragni Soldier
items.name: Corpse

items.lore: "Only the most wicked in Gavel could dream of a circumstance as what plagues this Wynn province." -King of Ragni
items.name: Macabre

items.lore: This short spear was the first weapon to be produced by the villagers for sale. They are old, but strong.
items.name: Maltic's Old Spear

items.lore: "As much as they're terrifying, at least those lousy skeletons give us lots of bonemeal for the crops!" -Bylvis, Katoa Ranch Farmer
items.name: Sketiq

items.lore: Corkian technology was not the first to create an item that is capable  of recording noise. Artifacts from Time Valley were found to record ambient  sounds and distort them into ear-splitting sonic bursts.
items.name: Harsh Noise

items.lore: Many said making a bow out of iron would be slow and wasteful, but the weight of the iron arrow can pierce even stone.
items.name: Iron String

items.lore: It's a strange feeling, running forever to reach the horizon knowing another lies just as far past.
items.name: Aleph Null

items.lore: What lies beneath the brim of all that never was, that overflowing vastness which cannot spill?
items.name: Nonexistence

items.lore: This perfect-to-the-point-of-indistinguishability replica mask of Herbert von Legendary's face, painstakingly crafted by Corkus's most powerful machines with only the most expensive materials and featuring real moustache hair plucked from Doctor Legendary's face, is desperately handed over to attempt to placate those who have spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, broken the mold by continuing to spend an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, gone even further beyond spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge, pushed onward to prove that they will not stop spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge, and then ultimately garnered an unhealthy obsession for spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
items.internalName: Outlandish Replica Face Mask of Legendary Victory
items.name: Outlandish Replica Face Mask of Legendary Victory

items.lore: Are your heart, soul, and mind one? The ones who love are the most vulnerable. The ones who persist are the most detached. The ones who forget are the most naive. Only when you remove these impurities from your body could you reach the end.
items.name: Wanderlust

majorIds.name: Divine Honor
majorIds.description: &b+Divine Honor: &3Increases the bonus from Radiance by 5%. Bash deals &2✤ &3-15% per hit.

items.lore: This excessively ornate to-the-point-of-being-wasteful decorative mask, laser-cut from a meter's worth of pure diamond, is given to those who have spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, broken the mold by continuing to spend an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, gone even further beyond spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge, and then pushed onward to prove that they will not stop spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
items.internalName: Treasured Diamond Mask of Legendary Victory
items.name: Treasured Diamond Mask of Legendary Victory

items.lore: This excessively ornate decorative mask, moulded from 24 carat gold, is awarded to those who have both spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge and broken the mold by continuing to spend an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, and then gone even further beyond spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
items.internalName: Venerated Gold Mask of Legendary Victory
items.name: Venerated Gold Mask of Legendary Victory

majorIds.name: Gentle Glow
majorIds.description: &b+Gentle Glow: &3Orphion's Pulse and Fluid Healing restore more health, especially to allies, but at a slower speed

items.lore: This ornate decorative mask, fashioned from pure silver, is awarded to those who have spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge and broken the mold by continuing to spend an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
items.internalName: Revered Silver Mask of Legendary Victory
items.name: Revered Silver Mask of Legendary Victory

items.lore: The unearthly wood of eyestalk is durable, but with horrific cost. Pieces severed from the trunk continue to collect and cultivate the essence of abandoned eyes, and the unfortunate wearer becomes a catalyst for growth.
items.name: Keratoconus

items.lore: Honoring a mythical dwarven smith lost to the legends, these ornately-crafted boots are given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Hephaestus-Forged Sabatons

items.lore: Forged in direct tribute to the earth and its aspects, these ornately-crafted boots are given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Gaea-Hewn Boots

items.lore: Consecrated by Qira herself with blessings unknown to all but her, these ornately-crafted leggings are given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Eden-Blessed Guards

items.lore: With threads of fundamentally opposing magic delicately woven together, these ornately-crafted greaves are given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Chaos-Woven Greaves

items.lore: Steeped in the deepest energies of the Ahms region void, these ornately-crafted leggings are given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Abyss-Imbued Leggings

items.lore: An ephemeral moment in time captured by sheer force of magic, this ornately-crafted cloak is given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Twilight-Gilded Cloak

items.lore: There's a note in it. It doesn't seem to be addressed to you... "You're not beyond saving. But you must work to deserve to be saved."
items.name: Inhibitor֎

items.lore: No one knows how this extremely dense chestplate can even logically exist. It is almost paradoxical in nature, and affects its wearers in unfathomable ways.

majorIds.name: Magnet
majorIds.description: &b+Magnet: &3Pulls items dropped by mobs towards you

items.name: Gravity

items.lore: Dedicated to a place of courage revered by all warriors, this ornately-crafted chestplate is given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Elysium-Engraved Aegis

items.lore: The sheer bond between Adamastor and Urdar has manifested itself into a physical form due to their duress. Such power is not to be abused...
items.name: Dondasch

items.lore: Infused with the classical magicks of fire, water, and thunder, this ornately-crafted chestplate is given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Anima-Infused Cuirass

items.lore: The oddly uncomfortable helmet was hand sculpted from a mystic clay found only in the depths of Molten Heights. Not much is known about the substance.
items.name: Pisces

items.lore: Made of dark minerals and adorned with pure obsidian, this ornately-crafted helmet is given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Obsidian-Framed Helmet

items.lore: This decorative mask, crafted of bronze alloys, is awarded only to those who have spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
items.internalName: Esteemed Bronze Mask of Legendary Victory
items.name: Esteemed Bronze Mask of Legendary Victory

items.lore: Engraved with the beauty and mystery of the boreal lights, this ornately-crafted crown is given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
items.name: Boreal-Patterned Crown

items.lore: Those whose souls are lost to the Canyon of the Lost eternally seek form. They inhabit those who wear these boots, unknowingly dragging the soul of the wearer into their ranks if worn for too long, leaving a wandering husk.
items.name: Revenant

majorIds.name: Plague
majorIds.description: &b+Plague: &3Poisoned mobs spread their poison to nearby mobs

items.lore: During a spiritual journey to Kato temple, the sage Capian was presented with powerful spiritual boots with the intention to be used for peaceful magic, and not hard combat.
items.name: Capricorn

items.lore: A once-great hero left behind these sturdy, reliable greaves, trusting those after her to be able to use their power to protect others, should they don them. Her courage fuels their wearers.
items.name: Vaward

majorIds.name: Expunge
majorIds.description: &b+Expunge: &3When using Heal, cast one instant pulse that heals 20% of your max health

items.lore: Sheer strength exudes from these Orcish relics, simple sandals ill-fitting to humans or Villagers. Enchanted with power and rage rather than magic, the strength that is provided when they are worn is unparalleled.
items.name: Warchief

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Petrichor

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\] The make of this massive cloak is unlike anything seen before among the provinces. Foreign images shift and melt in ethereal projections within the inside.
items.name: Hetusol

items.lore: A tag on the inside of the hat reads: "Do not fly during thunderstorms! The wearer is liable for all injuries sustained while using this product."

majorIds.name: Windsurf
majorIds.description: &b+Windsurf: &3Righting Reflex lasts twice as long and is affected stronger by movement speed

items.name: Propeller Hat

items.lore: 450 years ago a demonic plague like no other spread through Gavel, killing thousands. That is, until a priest encased the disease inside a helmet and warned everyone never to wear it.
items.name: Necrosis

items.lore: This dark relic was found at the very bottom of the deepest trench of the ocean. It drains all light surrounding it, blinding everything in a strange abyssal darkness.
items.name: Aphotic

items.lore: These common leather boots were once owned by a barbarian with no magical prowess. Instead of enchanting it, he coated the soles in corrupted shards to punish those who opposed him.
items.name: Virgo

items.lore: Wybels have a strange attraction to cosmic magic, and many an owner will find them staring through the window at night. One, however, claims to have seen her Wybel making something out of white stardust. The abode was robbed shortly after, and the supposed item gone missing without confirmation of its existence.
items.name: Stardew

majorIds.name: Alter Ego
majorIds.description: &b+Alter Ego: &3Awakened can be activated after saving 40% less mana, but its duration is reduced by 25%.

items.lore: Many prophecies foretell of new eras. Most are fabricated or proven false in time. One passed through the Dogun caverns, however, tells of a dawn soon to break, in which the earth shall run red and return to flame. Fanatical sects whisper the coming of a new demonic god.
items.name: Dawnbreak

items.lore: The hide of the Touroto, an almost invincible Bull-like creature, is said to be pierced only by the horn of the Touroto itself, making it extremely valuable.
items.name: Taurus

items.lore: Forged directly from the bloody red stone mined from the Nether, they were locked away for fear of inciting insanity in those who wore them.
items.name: Nether's Scar

items.lore: For the belief of the cosmos’ defilement, the moon was noted to remain unchanged. Those with this belief live only for the light of the moon, desperately seeking to maintain it through means that would only darken the soul of the most devout. Such from them comes the word lunacy.
items.name: Moontower

items.lore: The gods of air and thunder, frustrated with being physically insubstantial alone, decided to band together to forge the ultimate leggings of defense.
items.name: Gemini

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\] You only have limited time. But what if, you could experience that time again? And again, and again...

majorIds.name: Sorcery
majorIds.description: &b+Sorcery: &330% chance for spells and attacks to cast a second time at no additional cost

items.name: Time Rift

items.lore: “The symbol of the river” is a name that is often synonymous with this garment, with many water like qualities surrounding it, heavily bathed in magical meaning.
items.name: Aquarius

items.lore: Despite being thin enough to blow away in the wind, this mineral-blended shawl holds the force of a supervolcano within its soft fabric.
items.name: Shawl of Gaea

items.lore: Many artifacts are found to incite rage in the wearer, and wizards old and new alike conjecture as to the purpose of them. Very few increase the latent abilities of the wearers to ensure havoc, and none to such a degree as these boots.
items.name: Slayer

items.lore: The hide of the centaur is extraordinarily magical in the right hands. It is told to allow the user to gain the swiftness of the horse, but also leaves them vulnerable to hard hitting attacks.
items.name: Sagittarius

majorIds.name: Hawkeye
majorIds.description: &b+Hawkeye: &3Condense Arrow Storm into a tight beam. Arrows deal &6✢ &310%, &e✦ &31%, and &f❋ &31%

items.lore: The last known crafts of Theorick before his fall in battle were pieces of armour crafted out of pure ice, all of which have melted save for these shimmering boots. The coldest gales and most suffocating heat nurture and repair the wearer instead of being stifling or deadly.
items.name: Boreal

items.lore: Every ounce of your suffering must be made worth it. Otherwise, what was the point of it all?

majorIds.name: Gruesome Knots
majorIds.description: &b+Gruesome Knots: &3Twisted Tether spends twice as much of your &bBlood Pool &4&l⚕ &3to deal triple damage

items.name: Pain Cycle

items.lore: This thick skinned jacket, imbued with the courage of a thousand lion hearts, will grant the user massive protection from all who target them.
items.name: Leo

items.lore: All those who wear these enchanted boots deposit a single fond memory into them. They are forgotten forever, but wearing them recalls every memory within vividly.
items.name: Memento

items.lore: Forged with the raw powers of both the earth and the sea, these boots were initially an attempt at creating a method of foot-travel over the seas. Despite the spectacular failure of that application, they remain a formidable and reliable set of armor.
items.name: Galleon

items.lore: Two iron horns adorn this helmet to enhance the warriors of the Eradian, Dwarves who specifically rode Rams into battle at incredible speed.
items.name: Aries

items.lore: An antique passed from the Caritat wreckage into the hands of the outcast elves of Efilim. So to honor the memory of the selfless family as inspired their self-imposed exile, their strongest healing spells were imbued into it, and sent to those who needed them most.
items.name: Resurgence

items.lore: Before the invention of magical weight detectors, there was a giant pair of public scales in Cinfras. Instead of being thrown away, they were reforged to be a formidable piece of armour.
items.name: Libra

majorIds.name: Soul Eater
majorIds.description: &b+Soul Eater: &3Devour and Harvester grant double mana. Decreases maximum marks by 1.

items.lore: ...As the heart fails, adrenaline pumps through the body in an attempt to provide energy and keep the victim alive, but medical action must be taken to ensure survival. -Excerpt from Aldorei Medical Tomes, Vol. 6
items.name: Cardiac Arrest

items.lore: The carapace of the common Maexi pet fire scarabs, while alone, only cause minor burns to the touch. However, when woven together, they produce a variety of cumulative effects.
items.name: Scorpio

items.lore: One of the very few physically-powerful artifacts of the Villagers, these boots were used in the initial crusades against the Green-skins, to overpower the Orcs via raw physical might. Though effective, they have not seen use in a long time.
items.name: Crusade Sabatons

items.lore: A condition of severely deficient supply of oxygen to the body that arises from abnormal breathing; practitioners that abuse specific magic combos are often found incapacitated by said condition.
items.name: Asphyxia

majorIds.name: Reckless Abandon
majorIds.description: &b+Reckless Abandon: &3Sacrifice War Scream's defense bonus to give Tempest two extra hits, extra damage, and extra speed

items.lore: The Phoenix Prince is a mythical figure spoken of in Avos legend. His crown cursed him in an endless cycle of death and rebirth.
items.name: Phoenix Prince's Crown

items.lore: Forged from mystic, previously unknown metals revealed in the deepest dwarven mining site to date, these sleek, glowing greaves are believed to be utterly indestructible.
items.name: Greaves of the Veneer

items.lore: Wealth and riches...but at what cost?
items.name: Discoverer

majorIds.name: Geocentrism
majorIds.description: &b+Geocentrism: &3Aura radiates from you instead of your Totem and can be cast any time

majorIds.name: Escape Route
majorIds.description: &b+Escape Route: &3Frenzy and Time Dilation charge twice as fast, but to a halved maximum.

items.lore: The Bantisu monks have developed this enigmatic sigil in their years of meditation and study. It blesses the wearer with luck and powerful psionic ability.
items.name: Third Eye

items.lore: Tisaun, a warrior tasked to fend off a corrupted siege alone, could find only a thin shirt and rusted spear to use before the attack. He defeated all 1000 enemies without taking a scratch, and his bravery infused his gear with that same strength.
items.name: Tisaun's Valor

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\] The old facemasks of the Eradian guards were forged from raw magma, and enchanted to remain searingly hot, so as to brand the wearer eternally with the mark of Rodoroc's elite.
items.name: Grillface

items.lore: A rogue inventor stole the plans for a steam jet booster from Corkus and reverse engineered them onto a set of boots. While effective, they are dangerous, prone to catastrophic failure.

majorIds.name: Lightweight
majorIds.description: &b+Lightweight: &3You no longer take fall damage

items.name: Steamjet Walkers

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\] This battered stone mask is of unknown origin, and has no openings for the eyes whatsoever. Indeed, all that can be seen while wearing it is that which makes you truly angry.
items.name: Outrage

majorIds.name: Freerunner
majorIds.description: &b+Freerunner: &3When your sprint bar is under 30% full, increase your sprint speed by +150%

majorIds.name: Taunt
majorIds.description: &b+Taunt: &3Mobs within 12 blocks target you upon casting War Scream

items.lore: You know better than anyone else that there’s always a sliver of truth behind the tallest of tales.

majorIds.name: Sorcery
majorIds.description: &b+Sorcery: &330% chance for spells and attacks to cast a second time at no additional cost

items.name: Runebound Chains

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Albedo

items.lore: A marvel of Corkus' electromagical advancements, this high-tech chestplate is equipped with steam jets to boost the user's speed, at a minimal cost to protection.
items.name: Booster Plate

items.lore: The last step towards purity. Dissolve and coagulate. Be anew.

majorIds.name: Temblor
majorIds.description: &b+Temblor: &3Bash gains +1 Area of Effect and is 25% faster

items.name: Iosis

items.lore: Donning this helmet sears your mind with images of a world on fire. These blistering thoughts pressure you to make that world a reality.
items.name: Conflagrate

items.lore: Wearing this deceptively simple shroud causes the user to fade into the shadows, sometimes flickering out of existence for a moment.
items.name: Dark Shroud

items.lore: This matted tangle of vines and marshland plants contains various herbal remedies woven into it. It is oddly comfortable, despite the thorns coating the inside.
items.name: Fenmask

items.lore: Fashioned from the cut tails of the now extinct Venti, these nearly immaterial boots are light as air and crackle with lightning.
items.name: Ventus Tail

majorIds.name: Saviour’s Sacrifice
majorIds.description: &b+Saviour’s Sacrifice: &3While under 50% maximum health, nearby allies gain 20% bonus damage and defence

items.lore: True to their promise, these goggles were left as a memento for Ohms when his lover Gale finally died. Light as air, Gale's carefree nature lends itself to those who don them.
items.name: Gale's Sight

items.lore: No reign lasts forever. Not while your schemes remain unnoticed.

majorIds.name: Cherry Bombs
majorIds.description: &b+Cherry Bombs: &3Turn Smoke Bomb into three firecrackers that fly farther, tighter, and deal high damage instantly

items.name: Conspirator's Trickpockets

majorIds.name: Entropy
majorIds.description: &b+Entropy: &3Meteor falls three times faster

majorIds.name: Plague
majorIds.description: &b+Plague: &3Poisoned mobs spread their poison to nearby mobs

items.lore: Andesite is a stone commonly used for weapons and construction, but tends to be ineffective as armor when impure. This sturdy chestplate, however, is testament to the strength of pure andesite.
items.name: Andesite Aegis

items.lore: These leggings are the last remaining piece of a historical set of armor, created with such power as to be thought impossible long ago.
items.name: Post-Ultima

items.lore: Taken from the Archwraith by a pious Shaman, this chestplate was immediately abandoned. Its few users since have turned to an all-consuming desire to seek out and realign the last vestiges of purity remaining in the Kander Forest.
items.name: Soul Ink

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Puppeteer

items.lore: While only a mockery of the original product, this line of helmets became wildly popular before legal disputes and safety concerns halted production.
items.name: The Forgery

items.lore: A brilliant relic supposedly originating from the Realm of Light, the creators of these strangely shaped boots are completely unknown.

majorIds.name: Lightweight
majorIds.description: &b+Lightweight: &3You no longer take fall damage

items.name: Passus Lux

items.lore: If the depths of hell allows you this, is staying human an equal trade or a fool's choice?

majorIds.name: Rally
majorIds.description: &b+Rally: &3Charge heals you by 10% and nearby allies by 15% on impact, but becomes harmless

items.name: Infernal Impulse

items.lore: “I have hope in me the likes of which you could never imagine, and despair the likes of which you shall never fathom. If I cannot satisfy the one, then I will indulge the other.”
items.name: The Siren's Call

items.lore: Ancient magicks are required to make these brilliant glasses, imbued with charity and selflessness. They allow sight beyond sight, rumoured to allow sight of a brilliant realm.

requirements.quest: Realm of Light IV - Finding the Light

items.name: Clearsight Spectacles

items.lore: Just a test item.
items.name: Diving Boots III

items.lore: Adamantite is a soft metal often added to exotic medicine to increase one's health, but a revolutionary blacksmith on Black Road, created a chestplate with an Adamantite alloy, which is advertised to bolster the users endurance.
items.name: Adamantite

items.lore: Imbued with the blood of the first werewolf, it was kept in Gelibord as a trophy before being stolen. Wearing it is said to mimic the effects of the lycanthropic curse.
items.name: Blood Moon

items.lore: Forged on Mage Island, the sparkling liquid-like armour is as hard as obsidian, but light and fluid as water. It glistens with the magic of the ocean winds.
items.name: Crystal

items.lore: Jingle jangle, while shaking your bells. Jingle jangle come the pockets of cash... Catch the trickster, send them to hell," their money is gone and off you've dashed!

majorIds.name: Greed
majorIds.description: &b+Greed: &3Picking up emeralds heals you and nearby players for 15% max health

items.name: The Jingling Jester

items.lore: The Blue Mask's physical traits are equal to that of paper, but the mystical properties enhance the wearers personal skills tenfold. The mask is thought to originate from an ancient Dernel tribe.
items.name: Blue Mask

items.lore: Although these boots are crafted from corrupted stone, they do not exhibit any corruptive effects on their wearers. Speculation abounds as to the reason.
items.name: Stalagmites

items.lore: These boots were standard issue to members of the prestigious, and now disbanded, Sodeta Guild, and given as a gift to the owners of Delnar Mansion one day.
items.name: Sodeta Boots

items.lore: Do you think you can survive with a sky choked by snow and ash? More importantly, do you think anything else can?

majorIds.name: Flashfreeze
majorIds.description: &b+Flashfreeze: &3Ice Snake is instant and freezes for +1s

items.name: Impact Winter

items.lore: Salvaged from the limbs of the Vulcor Adrenophage, they radiate extreme heat,  suffusing the body they attach to with that same heat. It almost feels as though your blood is heating to a frenetic boil.
items.name: Phage Pins

items.lore: The dark spectres of the decayed forests have created an insidious helmet to drain the spirit of those who wear it, and become servants to their dark whims. Many have fallen to its allure.
items.name: Spectre

items.lore: Used by the Temple of the Legends' strongest guard, the shielded plating is enchanted with a powerful ward to stave off the effects of the corruption.
items.name: Kelight's Shield

requirements.quest: Realm of Light III - A Headless History

items.lore: Cosmic energy permeates this deceptively dull-looking chestplate, having been crafted with stardust from a comet that only passes over Wynn every 1000 years.
items.name: Millennium

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Augoeides

items.lore: The runic message carved on these enigmatic boots cover hundreds of different languages, many of them disused, but what has been translated seems to describe a disaster soon to arrive to the world.
items.name: Bad Wolf

items.lore: Rumored to be crafted from a Dernic stone, these sinister boots radiate extremely powerful dark energy. They have absorbed the power of the raging seas in their time locked in Sarnfic.
items.name: Abysso Galoshes

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Antimony

items.lore: \[Community Event Winner\]
items.name: Masochist

items.lore: Spurred on by a drunken bet, the great Thanos smith Kratke improved a pair of leggings from a rival that were once thought to be perfection.
items.name: Kratke

items.lore: The ancient bones of the demon Garaheth are stronger than steel. They clamp down when worn to constrict the bearer, inciting a slow madness.
items.name: Cage of Bones

items.lore: Originating from the unspeakable dark land, looking into the helmet will show nothing but darkness. Wearing it is said to reverse your morality, as if it were draining your will to live into the void.
items.name: Call of the Void

items.lore: Just a test item.
items.name: Diving Boots II

items.lore: The armor worn by the enigmatic Matryoshka Idol. It appears to have a nearly uncountably high number of inlets and sockets set inside.
items.name: Matryoshka Shell

items.lore: This ancient Elven sacrificial mask contains only a sliver of its previous magic, yet the blessing of the Elven god Entia still greatly empowers those who don it.
items.name: Venison

items.lore: Despite being a much smaller settlement compared to the mighty citadel of Rodoroc, the dwarven smiths of Thanos still can forge mighty products, such as these heavy diamond-alloy boots.
items.name: Anchoryl

items.lore: These ancient, spark-coursing greaves are all that remains of the great thunder mage Ohms' favorite golem familiar after a dark force turned it against its masters.
items.name: Ohms' Rage

items.lore: You're seeing red... Time to see more of it.

majorIds.name: Explosive Impact
majorIds.description: &b+Explosive Impact: &3Your Exploding ID can trigger when hitting mobs with your Main Attack

items.name: Scarlet Veil

items.lore: These leggings hold the interest of many researching the corruption, as they are the only documented case of a non-corrupt fusion of dark and light energy, made of pure twilight.
items.name: Bridge of the Divide

items.lore: Torn scraps of metal line the inside of these boots. They provide no protection, instead forcing a constant adrenaline rush while worn.
items.name: Broken Balance

items.lore: One of the few remaining standard issue mails that were used against the first hordes to emerge from the infamous portal over 1000 years ago.
items.name: Ragni's Mail

items.lore: "I know the Beast may return one day...but these chains shall bind it for eternity." The inscription glows bright in the darkness.
items.name: Marius' Prison

items.lore: It bears the visage of a great hero. Thank you for participating in the Festival of the Heroes!
items.name: Hero's Mask

items.lore: Once cursed by a druid who had his grove chopped away by a greedy Villager, it was then purified and mass-produced for sale as armor, to the druid's utter disappointment.
items.name: Sawdust

items.lore: There have been many attempts to create a reliable power system in Llevigar, and this plasma-charged helmet was reforged from a notable prototype.
items.name: Shinespark

items.lore: One of the master tinkerer Cerid's greatest inventions, these odd gear-laced boots clink and chime with the sound of clockworks keeping its powerful magic dynamos constantly running.
items.name: Cerid's Ingenuity

items.lore: This battered chestplate was once worn by the legendary Wynnic protector, Bob, during the fearsome corrupted sieges before he gave it away to an old friend. An air of melancholy hangs over it.
items.name: Bob's Battle Chestplate

items.lore: Bending the fabric of reality to allow the wearer to take massive strides, these boots are rumored to contain rogue djinni to power them.

majorIds.name: Lightweight
majorIds.description: &b+Lightweight: &3You no longer take fall damage

items.name: Seven-League Boots

items.lore: These pure, snow-white leggings are rumored to have been crafted by the legendary ice mage Theorick. The people of Nesaak view them as cursed, seeking to destroy them in a bid to stop the endless winter surrounding them.
items.name: Winter's Essence

items.lore: They look extremely bulky and uncomfortable...do they have a right to call it "enhanced"?
items.name: Enhanced Duskshield

items.lore: This ill-fitting, bulky chestplate was never intended to be a chestplate at all. Rather, it is a broken fragment of an arm bracer, from the time of giants.
items.name: Giant's Bracer

items.lore: Occasional whisperings can be heard by the wearers of this stone mask, reforged from a phylactery of souls. Although not dangerous, staring into the eyes of the mask can bring fear of one's soul being trapped within.
items.name: Pelier

items.lore: The chains comprising the mesh are rusty and old. It looks terrible, especially with the newer metal added on.
items.name: Enhanced Assassin's Hood

majorIds.name: Cavalryman
majorIds.description: &b+Cavalryman: &3You may cast spells and attack with a -70% damage penalty while on a horse

items.lore: Just a test item.
items.name: Diving Boots I

items.lore: Many blacksmiths have tried to craft their products in this armor's image, but none so far have been able to capture the brilliance of these Bovemist-blessed greaves.
items.name: Holy Greaves

items.lore: The paintjob on the armor is incredibly garish. Who thinks to combine sea green, mud, hot pink, and neon yellow?
items.name: Enhanced Phosphene

items.lore: "After nearly getting trapped in an iron maiden, I figure I can study  those mummies just as well from home." -Achper, Almuj Archaeologist
items.name: Springtrap

items.lore: Materials of all sorts have been lashed together in this crude, blocky set of leggings. From darksteel to leather to rotting wood, each part is a perfect square. It has, so far, been impossible to recreate.
items.name: Chained Pixels

items.lore: The accursed mummy once wore this robe as a great pharaoh of the desert. It has long since rotted, leaving only a cursed shell of its former greatness.
items.name: Mummy's Rag

items.lore: Supposedly this chestplate belonged to a legendary paladin. The merchant has no explanation for why there are dozens of them.
items.name: Enhanced Zeal

items.lore: Adding hard metal onto a religious cap seems blasphemous to you. The merchant disagrees.
items.name: Enhanced Salience

items.lore: Found in a mystically-charged Giant ruin, these snug boots recall fond memories, incite calmness, and provide comfort for the wearer.
items.name: Giant Step

items.lore: The merchant launched into a tirade on how the hardness scale of stones means nothing the instant you saw part of the boots flake off upon being touched.
items.name: Enhanced Gypsum

items.lore: Some of the bones used to make the frame of the boots have crumbled. The merchant refuses to comment.
items.name: Enhanced Skeleton Boots

items.lore: What better excuse is there to sit in the shade and think about life?

majorIds.name: Peaceful Effigy
majorIds.description: &b+Peaceful Effigy: &3Your Totem will last twice as long

items.name: Philosopher

items.lore: Aside from the added plating, they look more or less intact. Somehow, that doesn't surprise you.
items.name: Enhanced Pickpockets

items.lore: Apparently, gluing some feathers on top of the decorative armor wings is supposed to allow you to fly- so says the merchant, at least.
items.name: Enhanced Icarus

items.lore: "We're trying to dig up history, not horrors! What is wrong with this province?!"  -Excavator Vade, WynnExcavation Site A Director
items.name: Dune Beast Jaw

items.lore: They look like at once point they may have been fairly upscale. Now they just look like a metallic mess.
items.name: Enhanced Oxford

items.lore: The psalm tag has been replaced with a custom message from the armorer. What it says about the original owner is better left to the imagination.
items.name: Enhanced Meditation Robe

items.lore: The blind prophet who crafted this macabre breastplate used the bones of only the most ruthless justiciars and executioners. Its wearers are supposedly destined to only die either a heroic or a just death.
items.name: Erratio

items.lore: The merchant insists that the wear and oxidation on the armor "is a feature."
items.name: Enhanced Copper Plate

items.lore: Worn by a terrible berserker during his fanatical rampage through the land, his rage permeates this horned blackiron helmet.
items.name: The Berserker's Helm

items.lore: The only difference you can see is that a tacky logo for Rymek Armoury has been stenciled onto the top.
items.name: Enhanced Umbrella Hat

items.lore: According to the tag on the heels, these boots leave a trail of snow no matter  where one walks with them.

majorIds.name: Snowy Steps
majorIds.description: &b+Snowy Steps: &3Leaves a trail of snow behind you

items.name: Snowtread Boots

items.lore: Looks like it was hastily repainted to match the colors of the mesa. ...but you can see the original greens and browns underneath.
items.name: Enhanced Hilltop

items.lore: Found in the middle of the Almuj desert, these greaves seem to slowly poison all life around them. Theorists suggest they were the handiwork of a wicked necromancer, though the truth is not known.
items.name: Dead Sands

items.lore: Llevigar's schools of wizardry are notorious for their difficult training regimens. These leg plates, forcing users to balance spellcasting with direct combat, are often cited as the tipping point for successful wizards.
items.name: Alternator

items.lore: "Some pigmen snuffle through dirt for things to eat. We dig up that soil to plant our crops in; it's always full of life." -Thomas, Ravine Village Resident
items.name: Mud

items.lore: Even ignoring the numerous scorches all over, these boots hardly look any better.
items.name: Enhanced Coalwalkers

items.lore: They added stilts to the leggings, so that they could "live up to the name." The fact you can barely stand in them is neatly avoided when you ask.
items.name: Enhanced Panorama

majorIds.name: Festive Spirit
majorIds.description: &b+Festive Spirit: &3Plays wintery tunes

items.lore: These boots were retrieved from a frozen man, uncovered on an expedition to Mt. Wynn. It is believed that the man had been wandering the world before his death.
items.name: Meanderthal

items.lore: "Strangest thing, it turns out Creepers are incredibly flammable..." -Garull, Cryptid Researcher
items.name: Garoth's Hope

items.lore: "With the corruption seemingly tied to the emeralds dug by the Roots, people thought gold was the next best thing, the idiots." -Gerald, Retired Miner
items.name: Gold Digger

items.lore: Recovered from a corrupted soldier who wore them, it was found dancing instead of attacking those around it. Even after it was killed, it jostled and jerked around like a dancing puppet.
items.name: Disco

items.lore: This chestplate was originally created as a memorial ornament to the lost lives of Ancient Nemract before being reforged into a powerful piece of armor for Nemract's guard.
items.name: Nemract's Ruin

items.lore: It is cold to the touch until worn. Once donned, it engulfs the wearer in excruciatingly hot flames, but never shall the wearer burn; only their enemies will feel the pain of the fire.
items.name: Little Inferno

items.lore: "Time travel cares less about small things like a flapping wing, and more about big things, like becoming your own grandfather." -Martyn, Time Valley Resident
items.name: Butterfly

items.lore: "With the hot, dry winds from the Roots and the cold, wet winds from Nesaak, these houses rot faster than you can blink." -Viraex, Elkurn Citizen
items.name: Brise

items.lore: "The skeletons at Ancient Nemract are rotted! is it even physically possible to rot a bone?" -Laen, Nemract Librarian
items.name: Black Ripper

items.lore: There used to be a constant battle between Almuj's thieves over these feather-light, gold-plated boots, until one day they were stolen by an unknown pickpocket and never seen again.
items.name: Almuj's Walker
